;

;On September 13, 2023, in Huzhou, Zhejiang, Qiu Jiahong came again Chen Meifeng's residence. (Southern Weekend reporter Zheng Dan/Photo)

;

;The gestational age is more than 8 months, premature birth, black hair, a baby boy. This is all 37-year-old Qiu Jiahong knows about the children she has never met.

;

;At 23:35 on September 16, 2022, Qiu Jiahong, who had just undergone caesarean section and induced labor, woke up from general anesthesia. The child’s father, Zheng Xiaobing, told her that after The baby came out dead and was taken away by the doctor.

;

;In Qiu Jiahong's account, when her originally healthy fetus was in labor, she was told by the hospital that "the baby was hypoxic and had abnormal brain nerves, so it would be aborted." Half a year later, she suddenly realized something was wrong. On the afternoon of the first day of the caesarean section to induce labor, she received a phone call from a number in Huzhou, Zhejiang Province. She called twice in a row. The old lady on the other end of the phone asked her if she wanted to give her child away? "It was inexplicable. I said how could I give it away, and then I died."

;

;As many doubts emerged little by little, Qiu Jiahong suspected that she had fallen into a trap of human traffickers. It was not for nothing that she became "prey". It was a reason that made it difficult for her to talk about it - the child she gave birth to out of wedlock was Zheng Xiaobing's illegitimate son.

;

;Qiu Jiahong believes that the child is still alive. She decided to follow the strange number to find her son. Unexpectedly, a combination of circumstances led to a major underground surrogacy and child trafficking case. As of September 13, 2023, the police investigating the case found that multiple children were involved.

;

;Hiring a private detective to find a son

;

;It has been raining all morning. There are few people in the gray grain and oil wholesale market and it is quiet. Most of the rows of rolling shutter doors have been pulled down. Occasionally, there are a few takeaways. Members shuttle back and forth.

;

;Slim Qiu Jiahong led Southern Weekend reporters through the market, skillfully entered a nearby residential building, and followed the corridor covered with psoriasis advertisements to the door of Room 203. . This resident is the old lady who called her originally, and is now in a detention center.

;

;The old lady’s name is Chen Meifeng, 58 years old, from Putian, Fujian. Qiu Jiahong remembered that face clearly, with two arched eyebrows, deep bags under the eyes, a round face, high cheekbones, and a head of gray hair that exploded at the shoulders and was held up with a hairband. She is on the plump side, and in winter she often wears a black mink coat and wears black boots with strong soles.

;

;Six months ago, in February 2023, Qiu Jiahong hired two private detectives. The three drove from Shanghai to Huzhou, Zhejiang to find Chen Meifeng’s residence, trying to find her son who disappeared from the hospital here. She recalled that she had been squatting downstairs for a week in the cold weather, but she had never seen Chen Meifeng carrying her five or six-month-old baby boy out and about once.

;

;The confrontation with Chen Meifeng occurred on the 8th day of their stay. On February 23, Qiu Jiahong blocked Chen Meifeng at the door of Room 203 early in the morning, who was returning from a walk: "Aunt Chen, do you recognize me?"

;

;"No," Chen Meifeng's Mandarin was mixed with a strong Putian accent. Accent, she politely invited the visitor to sit in the house. The old man was cooking for his granddaughter, and the house was a little messy. Qiu Jiahong glanced around the room, but there was no baby boy. She asked again, "Then where did you get my number?"

;

;Chen Meifeng finally understood Qiu Jiahong's purpose. "I haven't called her before," she said, and then muttered, "I don't remember." At Qiu Jiahong's insistent request, Chen Meifeng was accompanied to a nearby mobile business hall to retrieve communication records within six months. Qiu Jiahong's phone number indeed appeared in it, and the call time was 16:29 on September 15, 2022.

;

;;

;

;One ​​early morning in February 2023, Chen Meifeng took her granddaughter back to the house. (Photo courtesy of interviewee)

;

;Qiu Jiahong did not pay attention at the time. Before and after Chen Meifeng called her, she made three phone calls to the same person. , and later found to be the number of Chen Yongjin, director of Zhejiang Meifubao Women's and Children's Hospital (hereinafter referred to as Meifubao Hospital). On September 16, 2022, Qiu Jiahong gave birth at Meifubao Hospital in Hangzhou.

;

;Later, Qiu Jiahong learned from the police that the two were fellow Putian residents. Chen Yongjin’s response to this matter was, “Maybe I told Chen Meifeng (Qiu Jiahong’s contact information), but I’m not sure.”

;

;Qiu Jiahong remembered that after the caesarean section, Three days later, Yu Yanfen, the surgeon who performed the surgery, walked into her ward to do some daily routine. "I was in a bit of a daze because of the pain. She chatted with me for two hours, asking me what my brothers and sisters did and what my husband did. How did we meet? We talked like one of our own people."

;

;"After a series of reflections, I felt something was wrong. She must have come to my ward to inquire about information. "Qiu Jiahong determined that the child was alive, but was sold by Chen Meifeng and Mei Fubao Hospital; her boyfriend Zheng Xiaobing was also suspected of "giving away" the child, so the two had a dispute and parted ways.

;

;Faced with Qiu Jiahong and the private detective questioning her child's whereabouts, Chen Meifeng cried, "I really don't remember (calling Qiu Jiahong), I never did it ( Abduction and trafficking of Qiu Jiahong’s son).” In a live video on February 23, Chen Meifeng offered, “How about we go to the police station.”

;

;That night, Qiu Jiahong Reported the crime and Chen Meifeng was arrested. The next day, the Huzhou South Taihu New District Branch of the Huzhou Municipal Public Security Bureau, Zhejiang Province issued a decision on filing the case: According to the provisions of Article 109 of the Criminal Procedure Law of the People's Republic of China, it was decided to file the case of abduction and trafficking of women and children in the South Taihu New District. reconnaissance.

;

;Six months later, the police investigating the case told Qiu Jiahong that Chen Meifeng mainly made money from selling babies and surrogacy business. As for the sale of children, investigation has revealed that many children were sold, and the case has been taken seriously by the Ministry of Public Security. Although the surrogacy business is illegal, it is not a criminal act and is therefore not within the scope of this police investigation.

;

;The Southeast Asian surrogate girl behind the door

;

;It was an accident to expose Chen Meifeng’s surrogacy nest .

;

;Qiu Jiahong and his party did not get much information during the time they were stationed at the grain and oil wholesale market: they were probably Chen Meifeng and his wife, his son and daughter-in-law, and his two granddaughters. A family of six lives here. They rarely go out and don't like to greet their neighbors. Occasionally, the mother-in-law and daughter-in-law would take turns driving a black BMW to go out. The most frequent place they went to was the nearby Huzhou Maria Maternity Hospital.

;

;Qiu Jiahong discovered that every evening, Chen Meifeng would carry her little granddaughter around to the back row and disappear into Room 407 of another residential building. At one o'clock, we returned to room 203. During the day, Chen Meifeng’s daughter-in-law would ride an electric bike to and from the front and back houses twice, carrying her lunch box. When the mother-in-law and daughter-in-law leave room 407, they will insert the key into the door hole and twist it several times.

;

;In the first few days, Qiu Jiahong heard the cry of a baby in Room 203, where Chen Meifeng was humming to comfort the child. The small milk box hanging at the door will receive a box of fresh goat milk for babies every morning. After a few days, the crying completely disappeared.

;

;Qiu Jiahong guessed that the crying sound belonged to her son. It was probably because of the commotion that Chen Meifeng placed the child in Room 407 in the back row. "One night, I followed and listened secretly. There were many people's voices inside, and I felt something was wrong."

;

;If she hadn't seen it with her own eyes, she wouldn't have thought anything of it. You would believe that behind the door of Room 407, there are actually three surrogate girls from Southeast Asian countries, all about 20 years old, and two of them have big bellies. When Qiu Jiahong saw them, they were lying on the bed, using their smartphones without phone cards installed. The furnishings in the house are messy. When you open the refrigerator, you will find a lot of miscarriage and blood-replenishing medicines. There are discarded medical materials in the trash can.

;

;In a video recorded by Qiu Jiahong and a fellow private detective after entering the house on February 23, a woman who calls herself Lili is silent at first, and then Expressing in unskilled Chinese, I am from Vietnam and am 6 months pregnant, while the girl on the bed next to me is 3 months pregnant. On the bedside table between the two of them was a box of capsules for the prevention and treatment of iron deficiency anemia.

;

;When asked how much money she could earn by giving birth to a child, Lili replied, "I don't know. I haven't given birth yet. I won't know how much money I will pay until I give birth."

;

;She She said that she found Chen Meifeng through her sister's introduction, "My sister gave birth here and she has gone back after giving birth. She gave birth to a girl and she said she had more than 20,000 (RMB)."

;

;Another woman living in the attic of 407 said she was introduced to her by netizens on short video software. In a video, the woman said she had just arrived and was not pregnant yet. "Someone introduced me here and asked Aunt Chen to help me find a job, so I came here." The contact information of the person who introduced her here has been lost because "the phone has no card and the phone number has been deleted."

;

;Later, Huzhou police found out that two of the surrogate women were from Cambodia. "Both girls came here with visas and got married here. For surrogacy, both parents (buyers) provide sperm and eggs, and they just borrow the mother's body." On September 13, a Southern Weekend reporter accompanied Qiu Jiahong there When the Huzhou Kangshan Police Station inquired about the case, a police officer from the police station said.

;

;;

;

;Huzhou, Zhejiang, Room 407, where a Southeast Asian surrogate woman once lived. (Southern Weekend reporter Zheng Dan/Photo)

;

;"Surrogacy in some Southeast Asian countries such as Thailand is cheaper than in China, and the price of domestic pregnant mothers has been skyrocketed. It’s very high.” Lao Cheng (pseudonym), the person in charge of an underground surrogacy agency, told Southern Weekend reporters that domestic pregnant mothers generally come from relatively poor areas. “We are looking for those between the ages of 25 and 32 who have given birth to one child. Lord”.

;

;According to the process, every time Lao Cheng receives pregnant mothers, he will arrange for them to undergo a full physical examination first. "Those who are qualified will stay with us, and as soon as they get their period, we will let them take fertility drugs at an early stage, establish an artificial cycle, monitor the endometrium, and find a suitable opportunity to arrange embryo transfer."

;

;In a complete surrogacy industry chain, it includes buyers, pregnant mothers, surrogacy agencies, private laboratories used for test tubes, and maternity hospitals that can issue false birth certificates.

;

;The "Human Assisted Reproductive Technology Specifications" revised by the former Ministry of Health in 2003 clearly stipulates that any form of buying and selling of gametes, zygotes, embryos, medical institutions and medical personnel is prohibited No form of surrogacy technology is allowed.

;

;However, this regulation is only binding on medical institutions and medical personnel, and cannot prevent organizations and individuals outside medical institutions from implementing surrogacy. The Civil Code does not explicitly regulate surrogacy, and surrogacy has become an underground business that wanders in a gray area all year round.

;

;"To put it bluntly, when we do this, you (the buyer) and I (the seller) have no risk, because we are in a blank area of ​​​​the law. All risks are concentrated Among doctors and medical institutions, firstly, during the in vitro fertilization process, the sperm and egg must be transplanted to the pregnant mother, which is very risky; secondly, during the subsequent production process, the hospital needs to write down the child’s birth certificate as written by both of you and your husband (buyer). ) name is also risky." Lao Cheng said.

;

;For customers who want to find a surrogate mother in Shanghai, Lao Cheng offers a surrogate price of 680,000 yuan, and the customer can specify the gender of the child for an additional 80,000 yuan. "Public hospitals are more strictly monitored and it is not easy to operate test tubes. Basically, they are done in smart laboratories outside. If you require that the test tubes must be done in a public tertiary hospital, we can also arrange it and add 80,000."

;

;According to Chen Meifeng's husband Wu Yuzhang, Chen Meifeng once wanted to open a surrogacy store in Putian. In November 2020, she registered Putian Tianding Health Management Co., Ltd. in her hometown. “There is no (surrogacy) here in Putian, let’s see how to open one. After registering, if it doesn’t work, it won’t be open.”

;

;Southern Weekend reporter visited It was discovered that this was a small and micro enterprise located in a residential area with no signboard or facade. Because it failed to publish its annual report in compliance with regulations twice, the company has been included in the list of operating abnormalities.

;

;A midwifery hospital

;

;On September 10, 2023, a Southern Weekend reporter met in Putian on the pretext of looking for a surrogate mother. We arrived at Wu Yuzhang, who is currently on bail awaiting trial. The 60-year-old man lives in his hometown with his son.

;

;"We haven't done it (surrogacy) for a long time. We only did it for a year and stopped doing it." When he learned that the visitor was looking for Chen Meifeng, Wu Yuzhang He became more vigilant and said, "I haven't been out at home in the past few years. She works in Shanghai. I can't figure out where she is."

;

;The living room in front of him It was empty, with a handbag from Huzhou Maria Maternity Hospital hanging on the toy pony on the ground.

;

;In Wu Yuzhang’s account, Chen Meifeng and him made shoe molds at home more than ten years ago. “We set up a factory ourselves and hired more than 30 workers. She is in charge of all the money." After her son went to study, Chen Meifeng proposed to earn money outside, saying that a friend in Putian introduced her to the hospital business. It was a job of driving patients from place to place to see a doctor. Sometimes I would also introduce patients from one hospital to another, earning a small referral fee.

;

;Huzhou Maria Obstetrics and Gynecology Hospital is Chen Meifeng’s relatively regular place of work. The staff of the hospital also confirmed to Southern Weekend reporters, “Chen Meifeng used to bring people here for medical treatment. , I haven’t seen her in the past six months.”

;

;"She knows how to see a doctor. She went to the hospital for training for several years. The doctors there gave her training, especially what kind of diseases girls have. She knows what kind of medicine to take and how much it costs." Wu Yuzhang said that Chen Meifeng went to high school and knew a lot, and even applied for a passport. "She specializes in dealing with obstetrics and gynecology hospitals. She is familiar with many hospitals in Zhejiang and Shanghai, as well as tertiary hospitals."

;

;The other side of this job , is to find suitable babies for sale in the hospital. According to police insiders, in the baby trafficking chain, Chen Meifeng plays the role of "sales introduction". She runs around several hospitals all year round, and the doctors involved in the case privately provide her with information about parents who induce labor or plan to abandon their babies after delivery. She then persuaded and coaxed these parents to give birth to children and leave them to her disposal.

;

;"Chen Meifeng was arrested and implicated me. I was arrested on the spot by the police for investigation. The police thought I was colluding with Chen Meifeng to sell babies, but in fact I only accepted surrogates." On September 22, Chen Yongjin told Southern Weekend reporters that after Chen Meifeng was arrested, many doctors in Mei Fubao Hospital were taken away by the police to take notes. The doctor who performed Qiu Jiahong's caesarean section was Yanfen has resigned. "She was also punished at that time. Anyway, this matter was quite big."

;

;;

;

;Zhejiang Meifubao Women's and Children's Hospital located in Hangzhou . (Southern Weekend reporter Zheng Dan/Photo)

;

;Industrial and commercial information shows that Meifubao Hospital was established in January 2016 with a registered capital of 30 million yuan. Private maternity hospital. Chen Yongjin joined as the legal representative in August 2016, and the original legal representative Chen Chunlai withdrew. Also changing the legal representative to Chen Yongjin was Chen Chunlai’s Zhejiang Meifubao Health Management Co., Ltd.

;

;Chen Chunlai is one of the 10 largest shareholders of Shanghai Medicilon Biopharmaceutical Co., Ltd., a well-known listed pharmaceutical company. Public information shows that Chen Chunlai is also the younger brother of Chen Chunlin, the general manager of the listed company. Like several other core executives surnamed Chen in Shanghai Medici Biotech, they all come from the Chen family, one of the "Four Great Families in Putian."

;

;"Before the accident, we accepted many surrogates, but now we no longer do them." Chen Yongjin said that in the past, Chen Meifeng often brought some pregnant women to Meifubao Hospital delivery. Every time a surrogacy business is accepted, it means that the hospital has to forge a birth certificate and fill in the name of the buyer in the column of the baby's parents. "Of the dozen or so children she sold, about four or five were born here. She told me that these children were all surrogates, and after they were born, they sold them privately."

;

;"Surrogacy and child abduction are two different things. As far as our hospital is concerned, I dare to do (play) borderline things. If I am found out, I will be fined at most, but I absolutely dare not We have done something completely illegal. Our daily turnover is 300,000 yuan, and our annual turnover is 10 billion. Such a large hospital cannot take this risk." Chen Yongjin emphasized to Southern Weekend reporters that Mei Fubao Hospital has never participated in Chen Meifeng's trafficking Children's illegal behavior was not previously known to them.

;

;On September 15, 2023, the Hangzhou Gongshu District Health Bureau fined Mei Fubao Hospital for failing to fill in and keep medical records as required. 140,000 yuan. The penalty decision also mentioned that from January 28, 2021 to March 27, 2022, Mei Fubao Hospital issued 6 false birth medical certificates, which constituted a violation of the law.

;

;"That's 6 (children delivered under the name of surrogacy). Chen Meifeng brought more than 6 children, and there were many others. It might be true There may be test tubes, but there may be others, but we don’t know yet,” Chen Yongjin said.

;

;As to whether Meifubao Hospital is involved in child trafficking, neither the Gongshu District Health Bureau nor the police disclosed relevant information, nor was it mentioned in the above-mentioned penalty decision.

;

;;

;

;Floor of the Obstetrics and Gynecology Department of Mei Fubao Hospital. (Southern Weekend reporter Zheng Dan/Photo)

;

;"She thinks it is not trafficking, but doing good deeds"

;

;Today, few people in Chen Meifeng’s hometown village in Licheng District, Putian City, know her name. There are few pedestrians in the deep part of the alley. On both sides of the bluestone brick road are small cement buildings of certain age. Some living rooms with open doors worship Mazu or the God of Wealth, and the air is filled with the smell of incense.

;

;“The original village was demolished and everyone moved out.” An elderly villager told Southern Weekend reporter, “She hasn’t been back for many years. I heard that they are doing medicine outside."

;

;After Chen Meifeng left, Wu Yuzhang said that because of the bulk sales of shoe molds, customers had too much credit and could not get back hundreds of thousands. , and I won’t do it anymore. He rented out his three-story building and two warehouses, collecting rent of more than 100,000 yuan a year.

;

;Later, Wu Yuzhang went to Huzhou, Zhejiang, to work as a logistics supporter for Chen Meifeng. He was responsible for buying vegetables, cooking and cleaning the house every day. "I asked her once or twice (about business), and she said why are you asking so many questions? You can just spend it if you have money, and you still care about so much."

;

;Wu Yuzhang doesn’t know everything. “(Surrogacy) women are too hard to find. We also found them from Kunming, Yunnan. It’s not easy. They (Chen Meifeng, etc.) also went to Thailand to do (surrogacy business) before. , Thailand may be more expensive." Wu Yuzhang said vaguely that buyers can choose the gender of the baby in advance, and the price is between 550,000 and 600,000 yuan; the surrogate buyer watches the surrogate girl from pregnancy to delivery, with a total quotation of 650,000 yuan.

;

;In fact, this is a price slightly lower than the market price. Southern Weekend reporters asked a number of underground surrogacy agencies. The starting prices are all around 700,000 yuan, but these agencies all said that all pregnant mothers come from China and there are no channels for foreign pregnant mothers.

;

;How much money can Chen Meifeng get from a surrogacy business? Will she buy and sell ready-made babies through hospital channels? Wu Yuzhang expressed that he “can’t figure it out”.

;

;The aforementioned police insider said that in the child trafficking transaction, Chen Meifeng would price a child from hundreds of thousands to 20 to 30 yuan based on the child's health. It ranges from 10,000 yuan to 20,000 yuan, and she gets a commission from a few thousand to 20,000 to 30,000 yuan.

;

;As of September 13, the police found multiple children who were bought and sold by Chen Meifeng and had traceable traces. All of them had obtained the biological parents of the children before selling them. agree. "She believes that doing this is not kidnapping, but doing good deeds. Because while she doesn't want children, she also needs children. She gives the unwanted children to those who need them, and she connects people along the way and collects hard work." Therefore, Chen Meifeng transferred all her children to those who needed them. Transaction records and chat records are preserved. To her, these are proof of "good deeds".

;

;Ten years ago, after being arrested, Tan Yongzhi, the main criminal in the huge case of abduction and trafficking of women and children supervised by the Ministry of Public Security, also claimed that he was doing good deeds. "I help people. When people want children, I help them. I don't directly find people to sell children." According to CCTV News, from 2008 to 2013, Tan Yongzhi organized or participated in the sale of 22 children, each of whom The selling price of the children ranges from 15,000 to 50,000 yuan, and Tan Yongzhi earns referral fees ranging from 1,000 to 6,000 yuan per order, making a total profit of more than 100,000 yuan. In the end, the Henan Higher People's Court sentenced Tan Yongzhi to death, and the Supreme People's Court approved it in 2016.

;

;The aforementioned people familiar with the matter said that unlike abduction in the traditional sense, Chen Meifeng’s child abduction and trafficking case was of an adoption nature. In Chen Meifeng's past transactions, a pair of parents sold their children for 170,000 yuan, and Chen received several thousand yuan in "milk powder money." Later, the parents thought that 170,000 yuan was too little, so they went to Chen Meifeng to beg for more money. If they didn't pay more, they called the police.

;

;On September 26, 2023, a Southern Weekend reporter called Huzhou Kangshan Police Station to inquire about the progress of the case. The police said that the case was investigated by the Huzhou South Taihu New District Branch of the Huzhou Municipal Public Security Bureau, and other information could not be disclosed for the time being.

;

;Another version

;

;Some of the children trafficked by Chen Meifeng suffered from congenital diseases or disabilities, and some were born out of wedlock." Not easy to deal with.” But there is no son of Qiu Jiahong among them. The police found no relevant clues in Chen Meifeng's transaction records and chat records in recent years.

;

;According to Chen Meifeng's statement disclosed by the police, when Qiu Jiahong disagreed with the sale on the phone, Chen claimed to have given up the idea.

;

;"The child just died. According to her wishes, the child was aborted and sent to the crematorium." Regarding Qiu Jiahong's son, Chen Yongjin told Southern Weekend The reporter's version is another version: Qiu Jiahong initially asked customer service whether she could abort the child, saying that the child had "some problems"; on August 22, 2022, she hesitated when she came to the hospital for an examination, and about a month later said she was sure to abort. Drop the child. "There was a man (Zheng Xiaobing) who came with him, and his attitude was to abort the child."

;

;"We only have one problem, the law stipulates 28 Fetuses over 10 weeks old cannot be induced, so we changed Qiu Jiahong's gestational age in the medical records to be smaller, and everything else is true." When Southern Weekend reporters asked about the whereabouts of Qiu Jiahong's son, Chen Yongjin asked: "If the child is alive, we She needs a birth certificate. The criminal police have already investigated and found out the buyers and sellers of more than a dozen children. Is she missing a child?"

;

;;

;

;2023 On September 15, 2019, the regulatory authorities decided to impose penalties on Mei Fubao Hospital. (Information map/picture)

;

;According to a survey by the Hangzhou Gongshu District Health Bureau, since April 2022, Meifubao Hospital has not issued B-ultrasounds. Inspection report sheets, falsification of second-trimester gestational age and other methods are used to induce labor in pregnant women with a gestational age of more than 28 weeks. The specific induced labor data is not registered and it is difficult to collect statistics.

;

;The penalty decision made public by the Gongshu District Health Bureau also mentioned that from September 15 to 16, 2022, Mei Fubao Hospital was the actual gestational age. At 37 weeks and 2 days, Qiu Jiahong underwent amniocentesis to induce labor with mifepristone combined with ethacridine injection and cesarean section to remove the fetus. In this regard, Qiu Jiahong said, "I only took two mifepristone tablets, which did not work at all, and I did not take an induction injection (ethacridine injection)."

;

;After Qiu Jiahong repeatedly asked about the case, the police told Qiu Jiahong that the investigation of Chen Meifeng's case was now nearing completion, but in the existing evidence, there was no clue that her baby was a live fetus.

;

;"We have all asked Zheng Xiaobing, Chen Meifeng and Xiao Mazai, who helped Chen Meifeng, and there is no clue about the child." September 13, 2023, When mentioning the child's father, Zheng Xiaobing, the policeman at the police station said: "The person who knows (the child's condition) best is that person."

;

;After that, a Southern Weekend reporter called Zheng Xiaobing asked if he knew the whereabouts of the child. The other party said, "I don't know about this matter" and hung up the phone.

;

;September 16 was the day when the child turned one year old. Qiu Jiahong drove alone to a village on the outskirts of Shanghai to find a fortune teller. After the fortune teller saw the trend of a few incense and smoke, he told her that the child was still there, and Qiu Jiahong felt a little more at ease.

;"Wenzhou, Zhejiang, Jiangnan Leather Factory has closed down", an advertisement once circulated in the streets The words express the sadness of Wenzhou leather shoes today.  

;

;Wenzhou leather shoes were once a symbol of the quality of domestic men's leather shoes in the last century. Aokang, a listed company bred in this small town, once became the leading company in Chinese men's leather shoes. It has been on the market for 11 years and is 35 years old. Recently, it has encountered a "mid-life crisis".

;

;On the evening of August 30, Zhejiang Aokang Shoes Co., Ltd. (abbreviation: ST Aokang, 603001.SH) released its 2023 semi-annual report. In the first half of the year, ST Aokang’s revenue was 1,644.4523 million yuan, a year-on-year increase of 12.22 %, and the net profit attributable to the parent company was 8.9976 million yuan, a year-on-year increase of 177.59%.  

;

;However, behind the overall red financial report is the "great damage to vitality" caused by the sharp decline in revenue that has lasted for many years and negative growth in 2022. In 2018, Aokang's total revenue was 3.043 billion. In 2022, the total revenue will be only 2.754 billion, and the net profit margin is even negative.

;

;In order to stabilize its market share, Aokang launched sports leather shoes in the first half of this year, inviting top celebrities to endorse and Dior designers to perfect the design. However, sports leather shoes that combine traditional leather shoes with sports shoes are difficult to sell. Make Aokang "change his destiny against heaven".  

;

;Taobao data shows that the price of Aokang sports leather shoes is on the high side, and the number of payers is relatively small. The best-selling celebrity sports leather shoes have more than a hundred people paying for them, while the other products have only a few people paying. ten people.  

;

;Not only Aokang, the domestic men’s leather shoe market is facing a collective winter.

;

;Since 2016, China's leather shoe production has declined and overall development has been weak. The market share of men's leather shoe brands has continued to decrease. The market share of the top ten companies in terms of business scale has decreased from 10.1% in 2011. to 6.9% in 2020.

;

;At the same time, the market for sports and leisure shoes continues to expand, almost doubling from 269.1 billion in 2018 to 425.1 billion in 2022.

;

;In addition to the impact of sports and leisure shoes, domestic men's leather shoes also lack the competitiveness to compete with international brands. Among the top ten best-selling men's leather shoe brands in 2020, only two are from mainland China, while the other brands come from Hong Kong, the United States, Italy and other countries or regions.

;

;Domestic brands are mostly sold for less than 500 yuan, and national brands such as Aokang and Red Dragonfly are priced at 300 to 400 yuan. They cannot get a share of the cake of the sinking economy, and it is difficult to attract high-end markets.  

;

;How should domestic men’s leather shoes break the situation? Today, "Know" will talk to you about the direction of domestic men's leather shoes.

;

;The moon, as the closest celestial body to us and the only satellite of the earth, always seems to give us a sense of distance and distance. An unusual sense of closeness. Astronomers believe that the moon and the earth had a super close contact in the beginning of time:

;

;There was an ancient dwarf planet in the early solar system, located at the Lagrange point of the earth-solar system, which was almost the same as As big as Mars. According to the giant collision hypothesis, about 4.533 billion years ago, the dwarf planet was perturbed by the gravity of Jupiter or Venus and deviated from its original position and collided with the early Earth. The debris produced by the collision eventually formed the moon.

;

;This ancient dwarf planet is often nicknamed "Theia" by Western astronomers. This is the name of a Titan goddess in Greek mythology who was the mother of Selene, the moon goddess. If we compare it to Chinese mythology, we may call this dwarf planet "Chang Xi".

;

;When it comes to the birth of the moon in Chinese mythology, many people will think of "Pangu opened the sky and used his eye as the moon." However, this setting actually appeared quite late. It was first seen in the Wei, Jin, Southern and Northern Dynasties: "In the past, when Pangu died, his head was the four mountains, his eyes were the sun and the moon, his fat was the rivers and seas, and his hair was the vegetation." In older myths, , Chang Xi is the goddess who gave birth to the moon. She combined with the god Di Jun and gave birth to twelve moons. The earth's revolution period around the sun is exactly twelve times the moon's revolution period around the earth. Therefore, most peoples in the world divide the year into twelve months.

;

;Compared with the coincidence of the revolution period, the changes of lunar eclipses and lunar phases provide more inspiration for earth mythology: the legend of "Tengu Eclipses the Moon" has long been familiar to the Chinese people; coincidentally, in In Nordic mythology, there is a similar story of "Sirius swallowing the moon": The wolves hated the light created by God, so a wolf named Skull chased the sun. When a solar eclipse occurred, Skull swallowed it. sun. Another wolf named Hati was responsible for chasing the moon, and when he caught up, a lunar eclipse occurred. At this time, people on the ground will beat gongs and drums to scare away the wolf.

;

;In Australian Aboriginal mythology, the moon god is often described as a beautiful man who gradually becomes fat due to laziness (full moon). At this time, his wife, the Sun Goddess, would chop him with an ax. Although the Moon God will hide in a big tree, he will eventually die and will be resurrected 3 days after his death.

;

;Coincidentally, the moon god Chandra in Indian mythology is also a suave and beautiful man. Legend has it that he had twenty-seven wives and promised to love each of them equally. However, after marriage, Luna broke her promise and only loved one of her wives, and refused to listen to her repeated advice. This resulted in complaints from the other twenty-six wives. The life of the Moon God disappeared due to the curse. When he was about to disappear, the Moon God sadly prayed to Lord Shiva. Lord Shiva restored the life energy of the Moon God through blessing; however, since the power of the curse cannot be taken back, the Moon God must go through the process of gain, fullness, food and loss.

;

;However, from a global perspective, handsome men on the moon are considered non-mainstream. Most of the moon gods in various countries are beauties. For example, in ancient Chinese mythology, the moon goddess is named "Wangshu", and she drives a moon carriage across the sky every night. "Huainanzi" also adds, "Yueyu is called Wangshu, and it is also called Xian'a". Literally explained, "Wangshu" means "good-looking" and "Xian'a" means "beautiful and good-looking". It can be seen from these two names that the ancients obviously believed that the Moon God was a beauty.

;

;This setting is not surprising. Compared with the sun, the moonlight appears white and cold. In addition, the moon's revolution cycle is similar to the female menstrual cycle, so it is reasonable for people to imagine the moon goddess as a beautiful woman. Selene in ancient Greek mythology was not only a beauty, but also drove a moon carriage. Among the Romans, the name of this moon god was Luna - the word "luna" representing the moon and the lunar calendar originated from this.

;

;When it comes to the beauty of the moon goddess, most Chinese people will immediately think of Chang'e. But Chang'e is not actually called this name, and she is not the Moon God at all: Chang'e is just a general name for the Fairy of the Moon Palace. She is the maid of the Moon God rather than the Moon God herself. Chang'e's name was originally written as Chang'e. Later, in order to avoid the taboo of Emperor Liu Heng of Han Dynasty, it was temporarily changed to "Chang'e" simply because the two words "hengchang" have similar meanings.

;

;Taboo avoidance in the Han Dynasty was not strict, and taboo avoidance was only a temporary expediency and should be changed back later. But I don’t know whether it was because Emperor Wen of the Han Dynasty was too beloved by the people, or because of the strong cultural influence of the Han Dynasty, a series of "constant changes to the ordinary" are still used today:

;

;The first sentence of the "Tao Te Ching" "The Tao can be Tao" , non-constant Tao" is still written as "Very Tao"; the "Snake of Hengshan" in "The Art of War" has always been written as "Snake of Changshan", and Changshan Zhao Zilong has become an allusion; and Chang'e's name is also called Today, Chang'e has become a rare word.

;

;It was also the Han Dynasty when Chang'e was forced to change her name, and Queen Mother Xi replaced Wangshu and became the new Moon Goddess. Then Taoism rose, and Taiyin Xingjun became the new moon god. This Taiyin Star King is said to be the Moon Mother Chang Xi. But whether it is the Queen Mother of the West or the Lord of Taiyin, they are all images of old women. The public obviously doesn't buy this, and still retains the impression that Luna is a beautiful woman. Therefore, it is not surprising that the "Fairy Chang'e", as a young maid, has replaced her boss and is regarded by everyone as the real moon goddess.

;

;In folk classics, Chang'e always holds the Jade Rabbit in her arms. However, when it comes to seniority, it may be more reasonable to have the Jade Rabbit holding Chang'e - the legend of the rabbit inside the moon is widely spread in East and Southeast Asia. The ancient Chinese books are among the earliest to record the legend of the Moon Rabbit. "Chu Ci·Tian Wen" says: "What virtue is there in the moonlight, when death brings fertility? What is the benefit of the moon, but the tutu is in the belly?" Therefore, the legends of various countries in East Asia and Southeast Asia The legend of the Moon Rabbit probably originated from China.

;

;However, the Native Americans on the other side of the Pacific also spread the legend of the Moon Rabbit, which is even more magical: In Aztec mythology, Quetzalcoatl once descended to earth for training and almost died of hunger and thirst. At this time, a rabbit offered himself as food to save his life. Quetzalcoatl was moved by the rabbit's noble dedication, and after restoring his divine power, he promoted the rabbit to the moon god.

;

;There are many versions of the Moon God in Mayan mythology, but almost all the images of the Moon God are holding a rabbit. After the arrival of Western colonists, the Mayans were unwilling to change their beliefs, and even stitched together Christianity and Mayan mythology: the sun god became Jehovah, the moon god became the Virgin Mary, and the corn god became Jesus Christ—I don’t know. How should they explain why Maria always held the rabbit?

;

;Many scholars believe that the legend of rabbits in the moon comes from the imagination of the shadow on the moon. However, so many ethnic groups around the world have various imaginations about shadows. For example, Europeans think that shadows look like a human face. Only the groups on the east and west sides of the Pacific believe that shadows resemble rabbits, which is too much of a coincidence. Therefore, some people also suspect that the legend of the Moon Rabbit may have been widely circulated among the ancestors as early as when the Native Americans left East Asia. Native Americans arrived in North America about 12,000 to 23,000 years ago. Based on this calculation, the legend of the Moon Rabbit may have been circulated for tens of thousands of years, and even now it has actually landed on the moon:

;

;1969 Before Apollo 11 landed on the moon, the astronauts in the cabin mentioned Chang'e and the Moon Rabbit in their conversation.

;

;Lynton Johnson Space Center: There is a lot of important news about the Apollo this morning, and one of them calls your attention to a cute girl with a big rabbit. According to an ancient legend, a beautiful Chinese girl named Chang'e has lived there for 4,000 years. It is said that she was exiled to the moon for stealing her husband's elixir of life. Perhaps her companion could be found - a huge Chinese rabbit, which always stood in the shade of the laurel tree and was easily spotted. The rabbit's name was not reported.

;

;Astronaut Buzz Aldrin: OK, we'll keep an eye on that bunny girl.

;

;my country's lunar rover was also named "Jade Rabbit" to pay tribute to this beautiful and ancient myth.

;

;In fact, our fate with the moon goes beyond that. According to the latest large collision theory, the ancient dwarf planet did not collide with the ancient Earth, but a head-on collision. The two planets were completely destroyed, forming the asteroid belt between the orbits of Mars and Venus, and then combined to form the Earth and the Moon. This also explains why the core accounts for such a large proportion of the Earth, because the core of the dwarf planet and the core of the Earth later merged into one, and the Earth's water may also come from the dwarf planet.

;

;From this perspective, each of us is actually half a lunar person - or half Theian/half Changxi person.

;

;Jinan is full of high-rise buildings. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;On September 22, 2023, at Qilu International Building, Jinan City, Shandong Province, Jinan Urban Development Group Assets Operation Management Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Jinan Chengfa) has opened bids for a project - recruiting housing marketing agents.

;

;The project is selling 1,341 units of commercial housing, with a total area of ​​about 166,000 square meters, involving 4 properties, and developers include Greenland, Longfor, Poly, etc. Based on the average listing price in September, the total value of these properties exceeds 2.8 billion yuan.

;

;It is worth noting that these houses are all existing houses and are first-hand residences. The project tenderer, Jinan Chengfa, is not a developer, but an urban investment company engaged in real estate development and operation, and is 100% owned by the Jinan Municipal State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission.

;

;Not only in Jinan, on September 21, 2023, the Beijing Equity Exchange auctioned and transferred 154 properties. The transferor was the Beijing Chaoyang District Housing and Urban-Rural Development Committee, and the source of the assets was "physical assets of administrative institutions."

;

;Where do local urban investment companies and government departments get their housing from? Why are they for sale?

;

;;The product of "competitive construction";

;

;Lin Gang has worked in the Shandong branch of a national real estate company for seven or eight years. This time Jinan City Among the four properties for sale are projects of his company.

;

;He told Southern Weekend reporters that the hundreds of units for sale in the project were resettlement houses built by real estate companies during land auctions, and were transferred to Jinan City Development after completion.

;

;When the real estate market was booming in the past few years, real estate companies were vying for land across the country. In order to control land prices, local governments often limited the maximum price for land auctions. After the local auction reaches the maximum price, if the winner has not yet been determined, there will be a "competition for self-sustaining" and a "competition for construction".

;

;The so-called "competition for construction" means that after the developer's land quotation triggers the maximum price, it turns to competition for the construction area of ​​affordable housing. The one with the largest construction area is the winner. The housing provided is owned by the local government.

;

;Lin Gang recalled that the above-mentioned land was purchased around 2018. In order to successfully bid, the company built two buildings as resettlement houses in a community of two to three thousand households, which increased the cost by more than 60 million yuan. But after the house was put on the market, the market price dropped and the entire project lost money.

;

;At that time, Jinan had just begun to implement "competitive construction", which was still a minority in the country. Many cities usually use a lottery method to determine the winner after the land price triggers the maximum price limit.

;

;Lin Gang said that Jinan’s “competition for construction” has continued until now. In addition to the projects developed by his company, other properties sold in Jinan City Development this time are also the product of "competition for construction".

;

;The "competition-to-build" housing was originally used as local affordable housing. Especially since the State Council issued the "Opinions on Accelerating the Development of Affordable Rental Housing" in 2021, various places have accelerated the financing of affordable rental housing. Listings. In August 2022, Jinan Chengfa publicly purchased 3,000 units of commercial housing as rental reserves.

;

;However, Lin Gang admitted that the rental effect of the resettlement houses built by his company in the community was not good. The above-mentioned project, which was put up for sale by Jinan Chengfa, was completed in 2020. In 2022, I heard that two buildings would be used for lease by the government. The owners who had already moved in expressed their opposition and were worried that the mix of tenants would affect the community environment.

;

;“Some owners have come up with a plan and want to build a wall in the community to separate the two supporting buildings.” Lin Gang said that the owners’ opinions were fed back to Jinan Chengfa. The other party did not agree.

;

;Because there are no companies near the community, it is not convenient for office workers to rent here and commute. The rental rate of the two resettlement houses has not been high. For Jinan Chengfa, this means limited rental income.

;

;Affected by the downturn in the real estate market, Jinan’s government fund income, which mainly comes from land sales, has been almost halved. Data from the Jinan Municipal Finance Bureau show that the city’s government fund revenue fell to 54.7 billion yuan in 2022 from 101.6 billion yuan in the previous year.

;

;“There have been very few land auctions in Jinan in the past four or five years.” Lin Gang said that under the influence of real estate regulation and the new crown epidemic, major real estate companies are shrinking, and Jinan’s land auction market continues to be cold. In order to maintain the team, his company has only acquired two pieces of land in Jinan in the past two years.

;

;In its prediction of the fiscal revenue and expenditure situation in 2023, the Jinan Municipal Government pointed out that fiscal operations are still in a state of tight balance, and the pressure to increase revenue, reduce expenditure and prevent risks is very high.

;

;In order to alleviate the contradiction between fiscal revenue and expenditure, the Jinan Municipal Government proposed in the 2023 budget report to increase the profit handover ratio of municipal state-owned enterprises to 20%, and transfer the municipal-level state-owned capital operating budget to the general public budget proportion increased to 35%.

;

;For Jinan Chengfa, who has a house in hand, the income from selling houses is obviously more substantial than renting. Taking the housing listings in Huatongyuan Community in Greenland as an example, Anjuke showed that the monthly rent for a three-bedroom apartment of about 140 square meters is 5,000 yuan, and the rent per square meter is about 38 yuan/month. If sold, the new house price is 22,000 yuan/square meter.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters called Jinan Chengfa many times, but the staff declined the interview because the person in charge was not available.

;

;;Revitalizing idle properties;

;

;Actually, this is not the first time Jinan State-owned Assets has sold commercial housing. In July 2023, the Dongcheng Yijia Community developed by Jinan Urban Construction Investment Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Jinan Urban Construction) was put on sale. Another property owned by the company, Xijiang Huafu, also announced that it will be launched for sale in the second half of 2023.

;

;After the equity penetration, Jinan Urban Construction is 90% owned by the Jinan State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission and 10% by the Shandong Finance Department.

;

;These two communities are called "civil servant communities" in Jinan. Southern Weekend reporters consulted in the name of home buyers. The sales staff of Jinan Urban Construction Yi said that the two communities combined have a total of about 12,000 units, which were completed and delivered in 2016 and 2019. Half of the building was previously sold to civil servants, and the remaining half has been vacant until 2023.

;

;Among them, Dongcheng Yijia Community has more than 4,000 units for sale this time, and Xijiang Huafu has more than 1,000 units, which are expected to be officially launched after the National Day holiday. "The two properties were originally off-plan properties and were sold internally by civil servants around 2013. The selling price was equivalent to the market price at that time."

;

;At that time, Lin Gang was still working as a real estate reporter for a newspaper in Jinan. "When I got to know this community, people had already chosen a house."

;

;In 2009, Jinan hosted the 11th National Games and built a new Olympic Sports Center in the east of the city as the main venue. After the National Games, the Jinan Municipal Government also began to move eastward, moving into the Long'ao Building, which is more than 100 meters away from the Olympic Sports Center.

;

;Civil servants from Jinan Municipal Government units subsequently moved to Longao Building to work. Many civil servants did not have houses or lived far away. In order to meet the housing needs, two residential communities, Dongcheng Yijia and Xijiang Huafu, were built. Judging from the distance displayed on the map software, the two communities are both within 3 kilometers of Longao Building.

;

;In October 2022, the Ministry of Finance issued the "Guiding Opinions on Revitalizing State-owned Assets of Administrative Institutions", requiring the implementation of the government's tight living requirements and accelerating the revitalization and utilization of various state-owned assets such as houses, land, and vehicles. .

;

;Today, more than 5,000 units of existing houses have been put on the market in two communities, Dongcheng Yijia and Xijiang Huafu, and Jinan's property market has been shocked. "This is amazing. The total number of online new houses signed in Jinan a year is only 40,000 to 50,000 units." Lin Gang sighed.

;

;The above-mentioned Jinan urban construction staff said that the current price of a small apartment of 95 square meters in Dongcheng Yijia is about 25,000 yuan/square meter, and the price of a large apartment of 175 square meters is about 29,000 yuan/square meter. Data from Lianjia.com shows that this price is lower than second-hand houses in the same area.

;

;“Because these two communities are all rough housing.” She said that in the two months since Dongcheng Yijia went on sale, more than 400 units have been sold.

;

;Lin Gang said that these two communities were built earlier, and the unit designs are not outstanding, which has also lowered the price to a certain extent. However, it has a superior location and is equipped with a high-quality school district. It is still popular after being listed and has a certain impact on surrounding second-hand houses.

;

;The 154 properties transferred by the Housing and Urban-Rural Development Committee of Chaoyang District, Beijing are similar to those in Jinan. This batch of properties is located in the China Railway Construction International City Community, and the listing price is also lower than the price of second-hand houses in the same community.

;

;According to the "Economic Observer" report, after the completion of China Railway Construction International City, some houses were repurchased by Chaoyang District Housing and Urban-Rural Development Committee and other units, with plans to use them to solve the housing problem of employees. Later, it was not fully implemented as planned, and some of the houses remain vacant to this day.

;

;Staff from the Chaoyang District Housing and Urban-Rural Development Committee provided Southern Weekend reporters with the phone number of the person in charge, but no one answered the call.

;

;(Lin Gang is a pseudonym at the request of the interviewee)

;

;The son who has been away from home for many years suddenly received a call from his old man. How will he face the call from his mother who wants to take a posthumous photo and explain what happened after her death?

;

;The documentary "House of God" from Taiwan starts with this phone call and reveals the painful past of a family. The son in the film is the documentary director Lu Yingliang.

;

;;

;

;The film is in Last year, it won four awards including the million-dollar first prize, the Best Documentary Award, the Best Editing Award and the Audience Choice Award at the Taipei Film Festival. It was also enthusiastically received during the film festival in Switzerland, and it also has a good score of 8.3 on Douban.

;

;Because the film cuts into the native family from the director's perspective and shows every detail of rural life, many people compared it to the 2017 "Four Spring".

;

;However, in addition to similar themes, similar perspectives, and both being filmed over a longer period of time, the emotional undertones of the two films are actually very different.

;

;;

;

;《Four "Spring" is like a simple literary utopia. We long to grow up in such a family, enjoy the influence of music, and have a warm life like the director; and "House of Gods" reproduces another situation of East Asian families - There was no dialogue, they tortured each other, and after "living" based on instinctive consciousness, they escaped from this cursed place.

;

;The mother who is thin and works all day long; the father who has nothing to do and is addicted to lottery tickets; and the brother who is just muddling along and accomplishing nothing. Director Lu Yingliang does not directly show the desperate state of these family members, but through a "god". A rare perspective that reflects everyone's inner world.

;

;In the director's hometown, there has always been a strong belief in gods, and the Lu family attaches particular importance to it. They have a separate room upstairs for worshiping a shrine and an incense altar.

;

;;

;

;All this source When Yu Lu Yingliang's brother was 12 years old, he suddenly became "psychic" and was chosen by the gods. He became a celebrity who traveled far and wide to seek guidance from gods. For many years after that, in addition to farm work, my brother also worked part-time as a fortune teller for others, and the Lu family became connected with the gods.

;

;But through the director’s lens, we will find that family members have different attitudes towards gods.

;

;Although my mother is in poor health, she still climbs up and down every day to worship the gods. When asked repeatedly by her son why she persisted, she said lonelyly: "In the past, when your brother left home, you and your father were not at home. Your sister went to work, and I was the only one left at home. They were all there to accompany me." Me."

;

;;

;

; Unlike his mother's simple emotional sustenance, his father is utilitarian towards gods. He always wanted to guess the numbers from the smoke coming out of the incense and use it to buy lottery tickets.

;

;My brother, who has been dealing with gods for half his life, gradually fell into an embarrassing situation on camera. The film specifically uses the "little tomato incident" to expose the conceptual gap between the two generations.

;

;Before planting tomatoes, my brother specifically asked the gods for instructions on the farming date.

;

;;

;

;But right here Not long after the fruit seedlings were planted, heavy rains for days flooded the farmland, but the gods did not play any role.

;

;The young nephew was unwilling. He first said angrily that he had stopped believing in gods for a long time, but soon after, he burst into tears, hoping that his brother could ask the gods to find a solution.

;

;The elder brother did not want to deceive his son, but in order to soothe the next generation's uneasiness and confusion, he could only pretend to have a breath with the gods, saying that Hua Tuo would greet his friends and solve the dilemma.

;

;Here, God becomes the comforter of this ordinary family. When the family finds no hope in reality, the more they place their hope on the gods.

;

;;

;

;Like a director When my brother was doing farm work, he asked in despair and confusion: "Do you really think God has helped our family? Or should I say, is there really a God?"

;

;There are few Chinese speakers. The film explores such metaphysical themes, not to mention situating this discussion among members of a rural family.

;

;Of course, we don’t need to compare "House of God" with religious films such as "First Reformed" and "The Last Temptation of Christ". Director Lu Yingliang does not have this ambition. The reason why he Raising this question is based on his despair for his original family.

;

;;

;

;Lu Yingliang's father He almost never fulfilled his responsibilities and only knew how to idle around. Even because of gambling debts in his early years, the whole family had to move. Although his elder brother was good-hearted, he lacked ability and failed to start his own business several times. He had to borrow money to pay off the debts.

;

;Lu Yingliang had no choice but to work hard in a big city at the age of 18 and almost never came back because he knew that once he fell into this house of gods and men, he would become the same as those god tablets and become the entrustment of the whole family. "hope".

;

;From the beginning of the film until the middle and later stages, Lu Yingliang rarely appears in the picture. He basically communicates sparsely with his family in voice-over, and is full of confrontation.

;

;This situation did not change until my father was suddenly diagnosed with cancer.

;

;;

;

;Lu Yingliang finally decided I helped my parents take photos of their deaths, and when choosing photos, I had a rare conversation with my father, and the family sat together, a rare moment of warmth and harmony.

;

;I believe this scene will make many people cry secretly, because its tenderness uses the photo of the deceased (death) as a bridge to connect. The resentment that had been built up for many years gradually dissipated, not because the Lu family was on the right track, but because his father would eventually pass away.

;

;This is a sad ending for an East Asian family. Just like the recent "That Time a Ghost and I Became Family", the father played by Tuo Zonghua finally opened his heart because Mao Bangyu had passed away. Regret makes people put aside their prejudices and their attitudes.

;

;;

;

;《神人Near the end of "Home", Lu Yingliang finally returned to the home that had made him frustrated. He tasted the sweetness from the tomatoes grown by his brother, and took his mother on a train to see the sea, fulfilling her long-cherished wish. .

;

;The place where this old woman lives is actually only a few dozen kilometers away from the coastline. Apart from her wedding photos, she only had one young and beautiful photo when she was young. All her life since then has been dedicated to it. Three children and a useless husband.

;

;If there is a god in "House of Gods", then it is Lu Yingliang's mother. She is the real glue of this family.

;

;;

;

;Watch "God When reading "Human Home", it always reminds me of Huang Zi's "Xiaowei" and Dapeng's "Auspicious Ruyi". One of these two films is an art film, and the other is a documentary in the form of a meta-film, but to some extent, they both belong to the category of private family films.

;

;The creators of these films have honestly presented the disease, death and discord among members of the native family, whether it is long-term silent hostility or uncontrollable tension. It all reminds us of the past.

;

;"House of Gods" may not be called a blockbuster of the year, let alone a high achievement in terms of images, but the sincerity of emotional expression is indeed something that has not been seen for a long time.

;

;Director Lu Yingliang went from watching his family worshiping gods with a cold eye, to shifting his perspective away from the gods and towards his parents and brothers. This change in perspective is clearly visible. This tells us invisibly that he no longer carefully observes himself and his family in a binary opposition, but chooses to recognize his former identity and accompany his mother on the endless coastline.
